intro: Casearia neblinae, commonly known as the misty casearia, is a species of flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the nutrient-poor soils of its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its ecosystem.
